result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis J Sprengel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 7-10-15, or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Huber privileges for work and treatment. Court does not recommends against electronic monitoring. Report by 10-27-14 by 3pm. Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court authorize transfer to Dodge County.
Consecutive to: to any sentence with credit for 2 days served
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurtis J Sprengel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kurtis J Sprengel in court with attorney Dawn M. Rablin.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has picked up a new case in Dodge county.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kurtis J Sprengel in court with attorney Dawn M. Rablin.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has been tested, just waiting for the results.  Defendant is employed, documentation needed.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kurtis J Sprengel in court with attorney Dawn M Rablin.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is employed and will get on track with treatment and testing.  Defendant needs to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Kurtis J Sprengel in court with attorney Dawn M Rablin.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kurtis J Sprengel in court with attorney Dawn M. Rablin.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Branch6, Room 310 Safety Building on 4-8-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
